igniteR: Firebase Authentication for R

Source: R/igniteR-package.R
igniteR-package.Rd

The igniteR package provides a comprehensive interface to the Firebase Authentication REST API. It allows R users to integrate Firebase Authentication into their applications, enabling user management, session handling, and profile updates.

Main Features

  • User Authentication:

    • sign_in_password - Sign in with email and password

    • sign_in_oauth - Sign in with OAuth providers

    • sign_up_password - Create new user accounts

  • Account Management:

    • reset_password - Send password reset emails

    • change_email - Update user email

    • delete_account - Delete user accounts

  • Email Operations:

    • send_email_verification - Send email verification

  • User Data Management:

    • get_user - Retrieve user profile data

Configuration

Before using the package, configure your Firebase project:

  • Set the FIREBASE_API_KEY environment variable with your Firebase API key.

  • Refer to Firebase's REST API documentation for additional details.

See also

Useful links:

  • https://github.com/project-greenhouse/igniteR

  • Report bugs at https://github.com/project-greenhouse/igniteR/issues

Author

Maintainer: Lauren Green ghouse.performance@gmail.com

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Sign up a new user
sign_up_password("user@example.com", "password123")

# Sign in
auth <- sign_in_password("user@example.com", "password123")

# Get user profile
profile <- get_user(auth$idToken)
} # }
